definitions.definition: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking:
examples: [ as form of address ] You fool, you missed your chance!

definitions.definition: to trick someone or make someone appear stupid in some way
to do something that makes other people think you are silly or not to be respected:
examples: I got a little drunk and made a fool of myself.
Any fool could tell that she was joking.

definitions.definition: to not be stupid or easily deceived:
examples: I notice Ed didn't offer to pay for her - he's no fool.

definitions.definition: said to mean that you think someone is being unwise:
examples: "I lent Rhoda £100 and she hasn't paid me back." "More fool you - you know what she's like!"
Don't be fooled by his appearance.

definitions.definition: used to tell someone that you do not believe what they have just said:
examples: "Really, I'm very happy." "You could have fooled me."
You've done some fool things in your time, but this beats everything.
